Question_1.Context: The study evaluates the efficacy of different dimensionality reduction techniques in single-cell RNA sequencing data analysis.
Question_1.Question: What is the primary focus of the Mantel test in this study?
Question_1.A: Assessing the computational efficiency of the techniques
Question_1.B: Evaluating the preservation of pairwise relationships between cells in the original and reduced spaces
Question_1.C: Measuring the classification accuracy of the K-nearest neighbor algorithm
Question_1.D: Determining the trustworthiness and continuity of the dimensionality reduction techniques
Question_1.Source: The Mantel test can be utilized along with the Pearson Correlation Coefficient (PCC) to evaluate the preservation of pairwise relationships between cells in the original HDS and their LDS representations.

Question_2.Context: The study compares the performance of different dimensionality reduction techniques in preserving local and global structures in single-cell RNA sequencing data.

Question_2.A: Assessing the computational efficiency of the techniques
Question_2.B: Evaluating the preservation of pairwise relationships between cells in the original and reduced spaces
Question_2.C: Measuring the classification accuracy of the K-nearest neighbor algorithm
Question_2.D: Determining the trustworthiness and continuity of the dimensionality reduction techniques
Question_2.Source: The MCC is a widely utilized performance metric for assessing prediction precision in multi-class classification tasks.

Question_4.Context: The study investigates the necessity of compactness preservation in the dimensionality reduction of single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Question_4.Question: What does the CP-PaCMAP algorithm aim to achieve in terms of data visualization?
Question_4.A: Preserve both local and global structures
Question_4.Source: Its ability to preserve both local and global structures, coupled with its enhanced computational efficiency, positions CP-PaCMAP as a promising tool for researchers seeking to gain deeper insights into cellular heterogeneity.
